message_1:
A factory has three machines which can be used to produce three different products. The table below shows the time (in hours) required by each machine to produce one unit of each product.

|         | Product A | Product B | Product C |
|---------|-----------|-----------|-----------|
| Machine 1   | 2         | 3         | 4         |
| Machine 2   | 1         | 2         | 3         |
| Machine 3   | 3         | 2         | 1         |

The factory has 100 hours of operating time per week. Determine how many units of each product the factory should produce to maximize total production.
message_2:
To maximize total production, we should assign each machine to the product it can produce most efficiently (i.e., the one that takes the least time). 

Machine 1 is most efficient at producing Product A (2 hours per unit).
Machine 2 is most efficient at producing Product A as well (1 hour per unit).
Machine 3 is most efficient at producing Product C (1 hour per unit).

Now, we need to allocate the 100 hours of operating time per week among the three machines.

Machine 1: 100 hours / 2 hours per unit of Product A = 50 units of Product A
Machine 2: 100 hours / 1 hour per unit of Product A = 100 units of Product A
Machine 3: 100 hours / 1 hour per unit of Product C = 100 units of Product C

So, the factory should produce 150 units of Product A and 100 units of Product C to maximize total production. No units of Product B will be produced.
